name: Combined Reasoning: Validate, Prove, Hypothesize
description: Requires chaining proof, validation, and hypothesis in one scenario

theory.natural_language: A compliance decision requires two things: evidence of training and evidence of access review. If training is missing, hypothesize the likely missing course. Access review must be validated as consistent (no conflicting approvals). Training course SEC-101 is mandatory for admins. User Mira is an admin who completed SEC-101. User Pavel is an admin with no training record. Access review for Pavel is conflicting: one record approves, another denies.

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. She completed SEC-101 and needs access review evidence, assumed consistent here.
expected_answer.explanation: Mira COMPLETED SEC_101 ∧ training requirement met

queries.natural_language: What training should Pavel likely complete?

expected_answer.natural_language: SEC-101 is mandatory for admins; Pavel should complete SEC-101.
No. There are conflicting approve and deny records.
expected_answer.explanation: Pavel ACCESS_REVIEW approves ∧ Pavel ACCESS_REVIEW denies ⇒ conflict
